src:
Kerjasama jahat
06 Nov 2019, 09:00 by Oleh Muhaamad Hafis Nawawi
TIGA individu termasuk seorang hakim akan didakwa di Mahkamah Khas Rasuah Shah Alam, hari ini atas pertuduhan membebaskan sembilan pendatang asing tanpa izin (Pati).
Suruhanjaya Pencegahan Rasuah Malaysia (SPRM) dalam satu kenyataan berkata, individu terbabit ialah Hakim Mahkamah Sesyen, Azmil Muntapha Abas, Timbalan Pendakwa Raya Khairul Azhwa Yusrie Mohamad dan peguam Noor Amirul Nazreen Anas.
“SPRM sudah mendapat izin daripada Peguam Negara bagi menuduh tiga individu terbabit di Mahkamah Khas Rasuah Shah Alam.
“Ketiga-tiga individu terbabit bakal menghadapi pertuduhan mengikut Akta SPRM 2009,” katanya.
Harian Metro pada 22 Julai lalu melaporkan seorang Hakim Mahkamah Sesyen di Kuala Kubu Bharu ditahan bagi membantu siasatan berhubung dakwaan membebaskan sembilan PATI yang sepatutnya dihantar ke Depot Tahanan Imigresen.
Ketua Pesuruhjaya SPRM Latheefa Koya dilaporkan mengesahkan penahanan hakim terbabit berkait dengan penahanan seorang peguam dan timbalan pendakwa raya serta beberapa anggota polis.
Malah, ketika ditahan SPRM turut menemui wang tunai RM82,500 daripada timbalan pendakwa raya berusia 32 tahun dipercayai diperoleh daripada hasil rasuah.
Tangkapan terhadap seorang peguam pula turut menemui wang tunai yang kemudian dianggarkan bernilai RM17,500.
Selain itu, turut ditahan enam anggota polis bertugas sebagai pegawai penyiasat jenayah di daerah Hulu Selangor dan anggota polis pengiring lokap mahkamah.
Bagaimanapun, mereka dilepaskan dengan jaminan selepas direman lima hari bagi membantu siasatan.

Berita Berkaitan
text:
Bad cooperation
06 Nov 2019, 09:00 by Muhaamad Hafis Nawawi
THREE individuals including a judge will be arraigned in the Shah Alam Special Criminal Court today on the charge of acquitting nine illegal immigrants (Death).
The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) in a statement said the individuals involved were Sessions Court Judge Azmil Muntapha Abas, Deputy Public Prosecutor Khairul Azhwa Yusrie Mohamad and Noor lawyer Amirul Nazreen Anas.
“The MACC has obtained permission from the Attorney-General to accuse three individuals in Shah Alam Special Criminal Court.
"All three individuals will face charges under the MACC Act 2009," he said.
Metro Daily reported on July 22 that a Sessions Court judge in Kuala Kubu Bharu was arrested to assist with an investigation into allegations of acquittal of nine PATI that should have been sent to the Immigration Detention Depot.
MACC chief commissioner Latheefa Koya reportedly confirmed the arrest of the judge in connection with the arrest of a lawyer and deputy prosecutor and several police members.
In fact, during the detention of the MACC, he also found RM82,500 in cash from a 32-year-old deputy prosecutor believed to be from corruption.
The arrest of a lawyer also found cash which was later estimated to be worth RM17,500.
In addition, six policemen were arrested as a criminal investigating officer in the Hulu Selangor district and a police escort escort.
However, they were released on bail after serving five days to assist in the investigation.
